definition: beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]

sentences.chinese: 管理員的問題美容師的帳戶。

sentences.english: Do I have to tip the assistant beauticians?
sentences.chinese: 我得付小費給助理美容師嗎？

sentences.english: The beautician completely invites the customer to this site by E-mail in closed service.
sentences.chinese: 美容師完全邀請客戶到本網站由封閉服務電子郵件。

sentences.english: I am a car beautician , Guangdong would like to know which side do you good?
sentences.chinese: 我是一名汽車美容師，想知道現在廣東哪邊好做嗎？

sentences.english: I'm going to the beautician to have a facial.
sentences.chinese: 我要去美容師那兒做臉。

sentences.english: A:I'm going to the beautician to have a facial.
sentences.chinese: 我要去美容師那兒做臉。

sentences.english: Estheticians are responsible for providing facials, waxing and body treatments, including massages and body scrubs.
sentences.chinese: 美容師服務包括臉部和身體的療程，按摩，脫毛等。

sentences.english: They will arrange a professional beautician according to your request.
sentences.chinese: 他們會根據您的需求安排專業的美容師。

sentences.english: Find the answers in this free video interview with a licensed cosmetologist.
sentences.chinese: 查找與持牌美容師在這個自由採訪視頻的答案。

sentences.english: My beautician said this style makes me looks professional.
sentences.chinese: 我的美容師說這種風格讓我看起來比較好。

sentences.english: Time may be a great healer, but it's a lousy beautician.
sentences.chinese: 時間也許是很好的療傷者，卻是個很差的美容師。

sentences.english: The “beauty doctor” was a term of derision.
I went regularly to a nutritionist, a barber, and a masseuse.
sentences.chinese: 我定期去見營養學家，美容師和按摩師。

sentences.english: Specific steps, please follow the guidance of professional beauticians.
sentences.chinese: 具體步驟，請遵循專業美容師指導。

sentences.english: The door-to-door service can be beauticians.
sentences.chinese: 這位美容師可以上門服務。

sentences.english: I trust my beautician a lot so why not go with me next time.
sentences.chinese: 我很信任我的美容師不如下次你跟我去。

definition: the feeling of actually being there
(TCM) interrogation, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
variant of 熱衷|热衷[re4 zhong1]
to raise a lantern and fight at night (idiom); fig. to work into the night/to burn the midnight oil
